content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with new people daily, this role is for you.

Whether you’re an experienced Optical Assistant or not, we can provide you with the tools to develop your skillset and the opportunity to further your career as a result.

You’ll be working with amazing brands and cutting-edge equipment, all alongside our supportive and friendly team of experts.

Additionally, you will also have the opportunity to impact the lives of our patients in a positive and meaningful way.

A new pair of glasses can make a huge difference to patients, and there’s nothing more rewarding than seeing them smile as they leave us with the perfect pair of frames.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme

About the Role

At Maloney Keady Opticians in Castlerea, we pride ourselves on providing a thoroughly professional and friendly service to all our patients.

Our aim is that you feel confident with your eyecare and you receive the service you expect.

We are looking for a full-time Optical Assistant to join us in delivering outstanding patient care. This role will be working Monday – Friday. No Saturday working.

You will be an integral part of our team here, helping us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

Educating others about the benefits of independent eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent, dedicated to providing our patients with an exceptional experience in practice.

Our local community is part of our identity, and we regularly see the benefits our work has when we’re out in the area too

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

EUR €14.00

Salary – Min

EUR €14.00

excerpt.rendered: What’s in it for you? If you’re naturally interested in fashion, science, and a role where you can interact with.

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives in Battle.

You didn’t become an Optometrist to sell glasses…

As an independent practice, Barracloughs can provide you with the clinical freedom, time, and equipment to solve problems and genuinely help people.

Our patient’s are loyal to us, returning year after year, meaning you’ll have the opportunity to see real continuity of care too.

We believe working with us will allow you to escape hollow targets whilst providing you with a platform to have your voice heard in practice.

You will also receive:

  • Your birthday off work
  • No Sunday or bank holiday working
  • Free & regular CPD courses
  • Access to Simply Health (claim cashback on healthcare purchases)
  • Retail discounts
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Attractive welcome bonus of £5000

About the Role

Barracloughs is looking for a full-time or part-time Optometrist to join us in delivering outstanding patient care in our Battle store.

You’ll be an integral part of our team here and will help us drive our service offering forward, always looking for opportunities to improve and innovate.

We’re also looking for someone who shares our dedication to putting patients first and spending the time needed to get to the bottom of their visual needs.

Just as important to us is the way you interact with patients. Providing a friendly, informative, and empathetic service is a must.

Ultimately, you must be an ambassador for our brand and profession within the local community.

Educating others about the benefits of eye care is an ongoing challenge and one that we look forward to meeting head-on with you as a part of our team.

About Us

We are a committed independent practice, dedicated to providing our patients with high-quality care and an exceptional experience in practice.

Additional Information:

  • Our test times are 30 to 40 minutes
  • We have 2 consulting rooms
  • Our testing equipment includes OCT, icare pro, testing rooms all with air conditioning
  • We are a team of 6
  • The role requires you to work 2 in 4 Saturdays a month.

Our local communities are a part of our identity here and we constantly see the benefits our work has when we’re out and about in the area.

What’s Next?

Click apply below and we will ensure you are contacted as soon as possible by one of our team.

Salary – Max

GBP £65,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £55,000.00

excerpt.rendered: What’s in it for you? This is an opportunity for you to make a difference in patients’ lives in Battle..

title.rendered: Joint Venture Partner – Optometrist job in Leyburn

content.rendered:
What’s in it for you?

The opportunity to own and run an already well established and successful private Optical practice in North Yorkshire. Orkney Opticians is the only Opticians in Leyburn and aside from an established and fiercely loyal patient network, the practice has the benefit of being situated in one of the most idyllic locations in the country. With waterfalls a mere walk away and the Yorkshire Dales on your doorstep, this opportunity will stand out to a tenacious Optometrist looking to relocate their family to a charming countryside market town and take the next leap in their career.

The practice benefits by being part of the Hakim Group, a support structure designed to make your ambitions come to life. We aren’t here to dictate your business strategy we’re here to redefine what independents can achieve. All the practices we support are profitable and see growing returns over time, with Orkney Opticians being no different. This means less risk with your money and a higher chance of increasing dividends.

Becoming a Joint Venture Partner Optometrist (JVP) is a special role within Hakim Group, and on paper, it’s quite simple:

Deliver a best-in-class service for your patients and your team members. The rest will look after itself.

Once you join the team, you will become part of a nationwide network of equally passionate and dedicated partners striving to deliver excellence. You will lead, shape, and develop your practice team and will be free to craft a truly unique experience for your patients.

You will also receive:

As Part of the Hakim Group the practice benefits from the following

  • A Marketing Department
  • An HR & Payroll Department
  • A Finance Department
  • An I.T Department
  • An Operations Department
  • A Buying Team
  • A Recruitment Team
  • A Legal Team
  • A Dedicated Practice Mentor

And much more. All staff within HG are entitled to the Hakim Group Benefits package, including access to Simply Health, a cash-back and rewards card, cycle to work scheme and much much more.

About the Role

For us, this is what being a JVP Optometrist is all about:

  • Becoming a leader
  • Creating and nurturing innovation
  • Constant and never-ending improvement
  • Playing as a team
  • Communication, communication, communication

If you are enjoying yourself, learning, and your team is happy to come into work every day to deliver an exceptional patient experience – that, for us, is true success.

It’s not work if you love what you do, and it’s our job to make that happen!

What’s Next?

If you are interested in becoming a JVP with Hakim Group and being the Director of your dream practice – click apply below, and a member of our team will contact you with more information!

Salary – Max

GBP £55,000.00

Salary – Min

GBP £50,000.00

excerpt.rendered: What’s in it for you? The opportunity to own and run an already well established and successful private Optical practice.

acf.job_address: Orkney Opticians - 1 high street  Leyburn, North Yorkshire DL8 5AQ United Kingdom
